headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Tucker Carlson Sits Down With Vladimir Putin In Moscow; Candidates Clash During Race To Fill George Santos' Senate Seat; Adoptable Pets In the Spotlight For Super Bowl Sunday. Aired 11:30a- 12p ET

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: This morning, new reaction to the two-hour video appearance shared by Vladimir Putin and Tucker Carlson. CNN Senior Correspondent Melissa Bell is with us now. Melissa, what was your big takeaway from this?

utterances.speaker: MELISSA BELL, CNN SENIOR CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, mostly this was as we'd expected, not the interview of an autocrat that you would expect any ordinary or proper journalist to carry out, John. In fact, it was remarkable in the questions how phony they were, the outrageous falsehoods that were made not just about Russian-Ukrainian history, but frankly, about American politics as well. That went completely unchallenged.But amidst this two-hour essentially propaganda stunt for Vladimir Putin just over a month before his election is due in Russia in March, what did emerge of interest perhaps the one part that stood out was when he was asked about the Wall Street Journal journalist Evan Gershkovich, who's been, of course, incarcerated since March of last year, pre-detention that has been extended and extended. But, of course, this journalist could face 20 years in jail. Tucker Carlson did ask the Russian president about his fate. This was what he had to say. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) VLADIMIR PUTIN, RUSSIAN PRESIDENT (through a translator): We are willing to solve it. But there are certain terms being discussed via special services channels. I believe an agreement can be reached. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: BELL
utterances.sentences: Now, what we did find out more about where the Russian demands being made for his release. In fact, specifically, the Russian president mentioned a Russian national who is currently serving a life sentence in a German jail for having killed a Chechen on the streets of Berlin in 2019, Vadim Krasikov. Now, you'll remember that at the time of Brittney Griner's release, it was Viktor Bout, a notorious Russian arms dealer that had been swapped for her release. And it could well be, we understand, that this particular Russian national that we understand had been part of Moscow's demands at the time of Brittney Griner's release may well prove to be the price of Evan Gershkovich's release. Certainly, some movement there and at least the hint of a glimpse of some hope for Evan's family and friends.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Well, let's hope. Melissa Bell, thank you so much for being with us. Appreciate it. Sara?

utterances.speaker: SARA SIDNER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: All right. Retired brigadier general Peter Zwack joins us now to discuss. General, after watching this interview, how big of a win is this for Putin and the Kremlin? I mean, what did you see in that interview that could potentially hurt Ukraine as well?BRIG. GEN. PETER ZWACK, (RET) U.S. ARMY: Sara, this was a significant success I think for the Russian Putin's information operat trying to present a reasonable face. It gave them justification. He'd been pretty well shut off from much of what he would call the free-minded world, people would listen. But Carlson, just the spectacle of this visit, gave Putin a two hours op -- two-hour opportunity to transmit. And it comes as no surprise to me. I was in Moscow before the war, at a conference. And late at night in the hotel, there was Tucker Carlson on a interview in Russia talking about these things. He's a rock star there. And so, the Russians brought him in, and Putin played him. I don't think that Carlson expected to be, frankly, used the way he was. And Putin has used -- dominated 80 percent of the conversation. Also, the -- right before the war, if you remember, Putin published a treatise, kind of explaining Ukraine and Russia and how Ukraine had no right to exist. It was a real country. And the same narrative again two years later.

utterances.speaker: ZWACK
utterances.sentences: In the near to midterm, Sara, no. Things have happened on the battlefield. And any, any negotiate if you will over Ukraine or on -- I don't want to say, on behalf of Ukraine has to be with Ukrainian consent.This is their country.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: ZWACK
utterances.sentences: And also, we would want to be in close touch and linked to our NATO and EU allies who had to have skin in this game too. No, I think -- I think doing anything -- the talk of a new administration and fixing it in 24 hours is just absolutely wrong. And it needs to be in concert with Ukraine and our allies, or else I don't think it holds much.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: The country that's being bombed out of its mind, it has to be a part of these negotiations. And Zelenskyy has been very, very clear that Russia has to leave before any kind of anything can happen. All right.I want to move on to Israel's war with Hamas. Netanyahu has just ordered the evacuation of Rafah. There are more than a million people there, many of them displaced from other parts of Gaza, just regular citizens. If Palestinians have to leave Rafah, where else can they go? It is such a highly populated place. Most densely populated city, perhaps in the world.

utterances.speaker: ZWACK
utterances.sentences: Sara, I think here, I am an ardent supporter of Israel. And I, along with most Americans, most people who support Israel including our leadership, that you can't countenance the civilian slaughter that is -- that is occurred in Gaza since that horrific day, on the seventh of October. When Israel had the moral high ground, and we support them -- supported them and we support them now.But it's ugly, it's hard. Pressure has to be put on Netanyahu in his hard, hard right -- (INAUDIBLE) members to stop or move out because this isn't working. And while a lot of -- Netanyahu still has a lot of support, it is -- it is also fading. Israel is marginalized. And this just gets more and more dangerous as we can see in a little late throughout the Middle East with Houthis and Iran-backed militias and all the things that we've been reading the last few days.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes, the fear of a wider war is real in the Middle East. Brigadier General Peter Zwack, thank you so much for your analysis today. Appreciate you. John?

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: A critical special election coming up on Tuesday in Long Island's battleground third Congressional district. Former Democratic Representative Tom Suozzi and Republican County Legislator Mazi Pilip facing off to replace the former representative, a name we all know, George Santos. And it's a race that could tell us a whole lot about what to expect in the 2024 presidential race. Let's bring in Miguel Marquez, CNN's senior national correspondent. Miguel, what were some of the major takeaways from their very confrontational jabs that were going on last night? We're seeing a little bit of that play back and forth right now. What is at stake here?

utterances.speaker: MIGUEL MARQUEZ, CNN SENIOR NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Yes, it was their one and only debates. And we're -- what three or four days from election day? Early voting is going on right now.Look. The stakes couldn't be higher for both parties. Democrats want to take this seat because the Congress is so thinly divided right now. If there is a vote again on the -- on the -- on the Mayorkas, an impeachment, whoever gets in in this race will be voting probably in that vote. So, that's how contested this race is right now. Look. This debate was very, very fiery. There was everything from abortion to gun control to Israel. The SALT tax and state and local tax deduction and reinstating that which is a tax that Donald Trump put into effect, that was one of the most heated debates at the moment. But immigration above all, it was the first thing the debate started about -- started with. And here's a little bit of how that debate went. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TOM SUOZZI, FORMER DEMOCRATIC REPRESENTATIVE
utterances.sentences: In 2018 when I was in Congress, I was one of only 18 Democrats that voted to fund ICE. When people said let's abolish ICE, I was only one of 18 Democrats. I went against my party.

utterances.speaker: MAZI PILIP, REPUBLICAN COUNTY LEGISLATOR
utterances.sentences: When you are in the majority in Congress, you voted to open the borders. You create a migrant crisis. And yes, you kicked ICE from here.Let me tell you. As a county executive, you are being charged of this county. Doesn't matter what the commissioner will tell you. In the end, you make that decision. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Suozzi0 and Pilip going at it. But at least they're talking about the issues because everyone was just talking about the lies that George Santos kept telling. We will see what happens. But a very interesting ways and I'm glad you're on it. Thank you, Miguel. Appreciate it. John.

utterances.speaker: MARQUEZ
utterances.sentences: You got it.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: All right. This morning, Finnair is asking passengers to voluntarily step on a scale when they check-in for their flights to Helsinki. Finland's national carrier says this will help give a more accurate estimate of aircraft weight before takeoff. 800 participants have signed up since Monday to join in the survey. In return, they're going to receive a gift, a very nice reflected baggage tag.A cruiser assessing the damage after an unprecedented tornado in February in Wisconsin. The National Weather Service confirms it was spotted just south of Madison last night. This is the first time ever a tornado has been reported in Wisconsin in February, this early. Officials do say it caused some injuries. The Los Angeles Lakers unveiled a new statue of Kobe Bryant. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: VANESSA BRYANT, WIDOW OF NBA LEGEND KOBE BRYANT
utterances.sentences: For the record, Kobe pick the pose you're about to see. So, if anyone has any issues with it -- (BLEEP)(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: That was Vanessa Bryant, Kobe's widow. The new 4000-pound bronze statue captures the moment that Bryant walked up the core following his career-high 81-point game against the Toronto Raptors in 2006. Sara?

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Dogs, puppies, cats, and kittens are meowing and barking their way to glory on the gridiron. Who will win the Great American Rescue Bowl this weekend, Team Cuddlers or Team Adorables?

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: That really is the big question. With us now is Beth Stern with North Shore Animal League America. What's going on here? What is the Rescue Bowl?

utterances.speaker: BETH STERN, NATIONAL SPOKESPERSON, NORTH SHORE ANIMAL LEAGUE AMERICA
utterances.sentences: First of all, I think they're all winners.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: If you called the cuddlers and adorables --

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: I mean, come on.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Who's the loser there? Yes, look at this. It's really a celebration of rescue and finding these guys' homes. So, where we are so proud to be on Great American Family, and we're going to be presenting this second annual Great American Rescue Ball. And we have adoptable dogs, cats, puppies, and kittens. I mean, what's better than that?

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Honestly, I've heard of the Puppy Bowl. I did not realize there was a Kitten Bowl.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: And I'm kind of impressed.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Who's this guy?

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: We'd love -- we'd love that -- it's the Rescue Bowl.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: This was -- look.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: So, we're really promoting going to your local shelters. We have shelter crosser -- shelter partners across the United States who are holding parties on that day where there are special adoption events. So, we're really using that day to focus on getting these guys home.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: There's a fight going on here. I think that's the two quarterbacks right there --

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Going at it over -- I don't know, what a cheeseburger that's there?

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Do some -- do some of these guys need introductions?

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Well, all of these are up -- all of these guys are up for adoption. Sara and I are holding a little sister duo from Puerto Rico.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Sisters.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: We just did a big rescue in Puerto Rico. We just did an upstate New York rescue. I have two kittens coming from Oman next week.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: I mean, we rescue from all over the world, really. The Rescue Ball, we features kittens from Hawaii that were displaced from the fire.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: So, the fires.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: So, really, we go and we get them from wherever they -- whenever they need us, North Shore Animal League America goes. And we were able to round up the most amazing dogs, cats, puppies, and kittens for Sunday.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: I mean the phone lines are open. How do people --

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: How do people will adopt? Yes.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: -- who were watching this, how can they get?

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: It couldn't be easier. We just -- you can just log on to animalleague.org and you can visit us at our Port Washington campus. And these guys will be there this afternoon.Everybody's healthy, ready to go, and yes, hopefully -- I don't think these guys will stand a chance. I think they'll be adopted --

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: I mean --

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: After your viewers see them within 10 minutes.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: I want to take them all home. There is a -- there are a couple of escape artists you will see.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Yes. We have Lucy as a little escape artist. And --

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: And do you know all their names, or do you not want to say because when people get them, they may have one?

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: You know what? I think on the website their names are there.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: But they were just given. I think once an animal comes home, they're adopted, the family should all join in and come up with the perfect name.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: That become part --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: How did this all start?

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: As someone who goes into Super Bowl Weekend, typically to watch football, but has noticed that there's all this other stuff that sprouting up and has over the years.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Well, I think on Sunday, it's the lead-up to the -- to the big football game.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: And what's so great about Great American Family, we are airing it at noon. So, it's before really the Super Bowl festivities start.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Watch your game. You know what I see is that they're really playing a lot with the San Francisco hamburger.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Oh, do you see --

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: What does that mean? Oh, they're definitely favoring the San Francisco stuff.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: They're taking the -- (INAUDIBLE) Yes. But there is a little --

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Sorry, Taylor.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes. I don't -- I don't know. That might be something --

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: These are anti-Taylor cast. I don't want to start a controversy. But these cats are going through the San Francisco paraphernalia.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: They're going for the -- look at -- look at -- I mean, it's happening -- it's happening. I do want to ask you. I think there are some statistics -- some numbers that -- well, there's a puppy bowl right there. But we have some statistics I think on --

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: On what's going on here. You know, the Cudlers and the Adorables as you're looking sort of at this, how long has this been going on and how long have you been doing this? And why is it so important to you personally? Because I know it is.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Well, I -- every year that we've been doing this --

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: They're scaping.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Over the last seven years -- eight years, it's the day of celebrating adoption and rescue.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: My husband and I are right now in really into animal rescue. We have 28 fosters right now, cats and kittens.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Special needs, once -- whoever needs us.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Wow. STERN

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: So, really partnering with Great American Family into spreading that in what we do and finding homes and forever families for kittens in need, I think that's the most important thing.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: It's so great.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: That's what it's all about. We've got -- and what --

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: This year is so fun because we opened up to puppies and dogs. So, we have got --

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Everything.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Inclusive -- it's inclusive.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Yes. and I --

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Beth Stern, thank you.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Thank you for what you do.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: And thank you for this lovely ending. We really appreciate it. Really.

utterances.speaker: STERN
utterances.sentences: I'm so happy that I was able to bring smiles today.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Thank you.
